required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Dual Therapy (Lopinavir/Ritonavir + LamivudinE) in Treatment-Experienced HIV Infected Patients in the Russian Federation
clinical_study.official_title: ProSpective, MultI-Center, Observational PrograM to Assess the Effectiveness of Dual TheraPy (Lopinavir/Ritonavir + LamivudinE) in Treatment-Experienced HIV Infected Patients in the Routine Clinical Settings of the Russian Federation (SIMPLE)

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to assess the virologic effectiveness of dual therapy (lopinavir/ ritonavir (LPV/r) + lamivudine (3TC)) in treatment-experienced human immunodeficiency virus 1 (HIV-1) infected participants with an undetectable plasma HIV-1 (ribonucleic acid) RNA level (for at least 6 months) at the 48 week time point of treatment in the routine clinical settings of the Russian Federation.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants on Dual Therapy (LPV/r + 3TC) With Undetectable HIV-1 RNA Level at Week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants on Dual Therapy (LPV/r + 3TC) With Undetectable HIV-1 RNA Level at Week 24
Absolute Values and Change From Baseline (BL) in HIV-1- RNA Viral Load at Week 24 (Untransformed Data)
Absolute Values and Change From Baseline (BL) in HIV-1- RNA Viral Load at Week 24 (Base-10 Logarithm Transformed Data)
Absolute Values and Change From Baseline in HIV-1- RNA Viral Load at Week 48 (Untransformed Data)
secondary_outcome.description: Statistics for absolute HIV-1 RNA viral load, where all participants with undetectable HIV-1-RNA viral load data were included into calculations with half of the lower indication limit (50/2 copies/mL, or 25.00 copies/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Values and Change From Baseline in HIV-1- RNA Viral Load at Week 48 (Base-10 Logarithm Transformed Data)
Absolute Values and Change From Baseline in CD4+ T-cell Counts (%) at Week 24
Absolute Values and Change From Baseline in CD4+ T-cell Counts (%) at Week 48

Number of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events were not recorded in a solicited manner as in an interventional trial, but were recorded by spontaneous reporting in line with the requirements described in European Medicines Agency (EMA) Guideline on Good Pharmacovigilance Practices (GVP) module VI and local pharmacovigilance practice of the Russian Federation.

arm_group.description: HIV-1-infected participants on any triple highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) with plasma HIV-1 ribonucleic acid (RNA) level < 50 copies/mL for at least 6 months (two consequently plasma HIV-1 RNA levels) transferred as medically appropriate to lopinavir with ritonavir plus lamivudine (LPV/r+3TC) as decided by the physician in the routine clinical settings. Or HIV-1 infected participants who were switched on the dual therapy (LPV/r+3TC) no more than 60 days prior to enrollment.

study_pop.textblock: HIV-1 infected participants on any triple HAART with undetectable plasma HIV-1 RNA level for at least 6 months (two consequently plasma HIV-1 RNA levels) transferred as medically appropriate to LPV/r + 3TC in the routine clinical settings.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 18 years and older (male and female).
2. HIV-1 infected patients on any triple HAART with plasma HIV-1 RNA level <50 copies/mL for at least 6 months (two consequently plasma HIV-1 RNA levels) transferred as medically appropriate to LPV/r + 3TC as decided by the physician in the routine clinical settings. Or HIV-1 infected patients who were switched on the dual therapy (LPV/r + 3TC) no more than 60 days ago.
3. Cumulative HAART experience at least 6 months.
4. Authorization (Consent) for Use/Disclosure of Data signed by the patient.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Contraindications to lopinavir/ritonavir and lamivudine
2. Previous participation in this program

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1 (HIV-1) Infected Participants
group.description: HIV-1-infected participants on any triple highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) with plasma HIV-1 ribonucleic acid (RNA) level < 50 copies/mL for at least 6 months (two consequently plasma HIV-1 RNA levels) transferred as medically appropriate to lopinavir with ritonavir plus lamivudine (LPV/r+3TC) as decided by the physician in the routine clinical settings. Or HIV-1 infected participants who were switched on the dual therapy (LPV/r+3TC) no more than 60 days prior to enrollment.

Or HIV-1 infected participants who were switched on the dual therapy (LPV/r+3TC) no more than 60 days prior to enrollment.

group.description: HIV-1infected participants on any triple HAART with plasma HIV-1 RNA level < 50 copies/mL for at least 6 months (two consequently plasma HIV-1 RNA levels) transferred as medically appropriate to LPV/r+3TC as decided by the physician in the routine clinical settings. Or HIV-1 infected participants who were switched on the dual therapy (LPV/r+3TC) no more than 60 days prior to enrollment.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
outcome.description: Adverse events were not recorded in a solicited manner as in an interventional trial, but were recorded by spontaneous reporting in line with the requirements described in European Medicines Agency (EMA) Guideline on Good Pharmacovigilance Practices (GVP) module VI and local pharmacovigilance practice of the Russian Federation.

reported_events.desc: This study is non-interventional. Therefore, adverse events were not recorded in a solicited manner as in an interventional trial, but were recorded by spontaneous reporting in line with the requirements described in EMA Guideline on GVP module VI and local pharmacovigilance practice of the Russian Federation.

group.title: HIV-1 Infected Participants
group.description: Treatment-experienced HIV-1 infected participants with an undetectable plasma HIV-1 RNA level lopinavir/ritonavir: tablet Lamivudine: tablet

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: AbbVie requests that any investigator or institution that plans on presenting/publishing results disclosure, provide written notification of their request 60 days prior to their presentation/publication. AbbVie requests that no presentation/publication will be instituted until 12 months after a study is completed, or after the first presentation/publication whichever occurs first. A delay may be proposed of a presentation/publication if AbbVie needs to secure patent or proprietary protection.
